file_content.text: Solida Hesk should be around somewhere....
My slavers are dead!
My honor guard as well. This is your fault, Mistress Hesk--you promised the Archon your home was secure!
The Archon reviewed my security himself, and if you have a problem--well. Why don't you slither back and let me handle this?
Precision strikes, expensive equipment, no Republic identification... don't tell me the Empire wants Makeb too, now?
The Republic's not a fan of bounty hunters these days, and you're not with the Hutts. Don't tell me the Empire wants Makeb, too, now?
So the Empire is on Makeb now? Trying to kill the Hutts while they're in one place, or do you trot after the Republic fleet wherever it goes?
Consider your position, Mistress Hesk. Your security is gone, your Hutts are displeased, and I'm your only hope for survival.
I wouldn't be so flippant.
I suggest you cooperate and tell me everything you know about isotope-5.
There's no need for insults. You're a businesswoman, and I'm here to ask questions--that's all.
Let's keep this civilized.
What do you know about isotope-5?
Isotope-5... right.
Yes, my company found it, mined it for our Hutt investors. Kept it a secret by their request.
Worst deal we ever made. It's because of the Hutts that we're going to lose Makeb.
Solida Hesk. Tell me about isotope-5.
Tell me what I want. [Choke her]
What? I don't... ah!
I came here for answers. Isotope-5--tell me what you know.
Tell me what I want. [Shock her]
Ah! Damn you.
I don't have a lot of time, so let's skip the denials and go straight to the brutality.
Tell me what I want. [Hurt her]
Your company mined the isotope-5 for the Hutts. I want to know everything about it.
I've never heard of isotope-5....
I said we skip the denials.
I was hired to get information. I'm not choosy about how I get it.
Tell me what I want. [Hurt her]
Tell me about isotope-5.
Ah! Damn it, fine!
Yes, we discovered the isotope-5 during deep-drilling operations, and yes, my Hutt investors kept it a secret.
But believe me, the Hutts are no friends of mine. Because their greed overwhelmed their sense, we're going to lose the whole blasted planet.
What are you talking about? How would you lose Makeb?
What does that mean?
You've been working with the Hutts for a long time. Don't claim you've changed now.
You're still a Hutt ally.
You want to know what the Hutts have done?
You sold out your whole world to a cartel of criminals. How did you expect it to end?
Betrayal is always a bad deal.
You're not understanding. I'm not being melodramatic--we're literally losing the planet!
Makeb only has a few weeks left before the planetary core rips apart. That's what happens when you extract isotope-5.
The groundquakes.
No more Makeb, no more isotope... and no more fancy resort or corporation. So yes, I'll need Hutt allies once my planet is gone.
How could isotope-5 cause that much damage? What exactly is going to happen?
Makeb is destroying itself?
Apparently, it regulates the planet's gravitational and electromagnetic fields. The groundquakes and storms are just the start--nothing will survive.
Do the Hutts know that Makeb is doomed?
Who else realizes all this?
Of course--that's why they're mining all the isotope-5 they can.
You doomed all of Makeb, and now you're worried about where to go next.
You disgusting weasel.
Yes, I am.
Go ahead, watch my hands, I'm not triggering any alarm... there. I've granted access to my corporate systems.
Checking. We're in.
I have information, money and influence, and I'm as happy to work with you as with the Hutts. Just help me survive.
She acts unforgivably.
She's not going to betray us today, and if anyone can mislead the Hutts about our presence, it's her.
Your assistance will not be necessary.
She deserves to die.
Ah!
Right... I'm purging her security records, at least. The Hutt Cartel will know something happened, but they'll have to work for the details.
My operation, my decision. Consider this a stay of execution, Hesk.
I want her as an ally.
Thank you. I'll keep funneling my resources to you and keep an ear out for anything new.
In the meantime, what should I tell the Hutts...?
The Empire knows the Republic is struggling with the Hutts over Makeb. Where the Republic goes, the Empire follows.
Blame it on the war.
Tell the Hutts that the Empire wants Makeb's mineral resources. The military is broke, and Makeb looked like easy funds.
Say the Empire is desperate.
I can sell that. Good luck out there.
You want to prove you're useful? Figure it out. I have bigger things to worry about.
I really don't care.
Delegation. I like it.
We'll check her corporate data and wait for you at the gravity hook. We can chat about the end of the world.
Something you want?
